column1: 0,pcs7_compendium_part_a_en-US_en-US.txt,104,1c724b5e81e92b070ac8bfd24478dc84acc18258db53014781201025c8178439,"The License Manager on the Information Server counts all active client connections. For each IS client computer on which one or more Information Server connections are active, an Information Server client access license is required.

column3: Information Server - Data Source Access (1 Client)
Information Server - Data Source Access (3 Client)

column1: Only one ""Information Server - Data Source Access"" license is required for a PCS 7 OS system, even if the system is configured redundantly.
Using an IPC 547E or IPC 847D is recommended.
The following software requirements apply to the Information Server:
The following are also required for reporting with MS Office:
- Visual Studio Tools for Office VSTO 4.0
You can find additional information in the following manuals:
- Application examples ""Installation, Operation and Maintenance of Process Historian/Information Server in a PCS 7 Environment""
- Application example ""Creating Report Templates for the Information Server on the Process Historian Database in the PCS 7 Environment""
The following requirements apply to using the Web solution:
- The Web solution can be implemented both in plants with a server/client structure as well as on OS single stations.

- The Web solution allows Web servers whose plants or plant areas still use a previous version of PCS 7 to also be accessed with a Web client. You will find further information on this in the FAQ ""What should you watch out for when installing the PCS 7 Web Option with respect to Web Cross Connectivity?"" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/92190315).

- In order to execute a process operation via faceplates, the OS hierarchy (Picture Tree) must be derived from the SIMATIC Manager plant hierarchy. At the very minimum, however, the area names used in the OS and AS must match.

In the case of a plant where the configuration is planned as a mixture of OS clients and Web clients, the permissible number of clients in terms of the load on the OS servers can be roughly calculated using this formula:
Number of OS clients * 2 + number of Web clients * 1 <= 60
The following points must be taken into account when configuring the Web solution:

- Where there is an existing server/client structure, the number of times run through to publish images, scripts and status displays for the Web server is based on the number of server packages downloaded (publishing operations: number of server packages + Web server).
- The ""WebNavigator"" option must be enabled and selected as the startup screen ""@Screen.pd_"" for the respective user in the User Administrator of the Web server.

,What is the purpose of the License Manager on the Information Server?,The License Manager counts all active client connections to the Information Server.,It ensures that for each IS client computer with active connections, a client access license is required.",To monitor and manage the licensing requirements for active Information Server connections.,The License Manager tracks active connections to enforce licensing policies.,Its role is to count active client connections and ensure proper licensing.

The following requirements apply to using the Web solution:
- The Web solution can be implemented both in plants with a server/client structure as well as on OS single stations.

- The Web solution allows Web servers whose plants or plant areas still use a previous version of PCS 7 to also be accessed with a Web client. (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/92190315).

- In order to execute a process operation via faceplates, the OS hierarchy (Picture Tree) must be derived from the SIMATIC Manager plant hierarchy. At the very minimum, however, the area names used in the OS and AS must match.

In the case of a plant where the configuration is planned as a mixture of OS clients and Web clients, the permissible number of clients in terms of the load on the OS servers can be roughly calculated using this formula:
Number of OS clients * 2 + number of Web clients * 1 <= 60
The following points must be taken into account when configuring the Web solution:

- Where there is an existing server/client structure, the number of times run through to publish images, scripts and status displays for the Web server is based on the number of server packages downloaded (publishing operations: number of server packages + Web server).
- The ""WebNavigator"" option must be enabled and selected as the startup screen ""@Screen.pd_"" for the respective user in the User Administrator of the Web server.

,What are the different types of client access licenses available for the Information Server?,Types include 1, 3, 5, and 10 Client Access licenses, and Data Source Access licenses for 1 and 3 clients.","Available licenses are Information Server - Client Access (1, 3, 5, 10 Client) and Data Source Access (1, 3 Client).","Client Access licenses vary by the number of clients (1, 3, 5, 10), and Data Source Access licenses are for 1 or 3 clients.",The server offers Client Access licenses in four sizes and Data Source Access in two.,Licenses range from single to ten client access and include options for data source access.

,How many 'Information Server - Data Source Access' licenses are required for a redundantly configured PCS 7 OS system?,Only one license is required, regardless of redundancy.",A single Data Source Access license suffices for a redundant PCS 7 OS system.,"One license covers it, even if the system is set up redundantly.",Redundancy doesn't increase the need; one Data Source Access license is enough.,"Just one license is needed for a PCS 7 OS system, redundant or not."

,What software requirements must be met for the Information Server?,Requirements include Windows 7 SP1 Ultimate/Enterprise, Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB, Windows Server 2012 R2, IIS, and IE 11.","Needed software: Windows 7 SP1, Windows 10 LTSB, Windows Server 2012 R2, IIS, and Internet Explorer 11.","The server requires specific Windows versions, IIS, and IE 11 to operate.","Windows 7 SP1, Windows 10 LTSB, Server 2012 R2, along with IIS and IE 11, are necessary.","Operating system, web server, and browser requirements must be fulfilled for the Information Server."

,What additional software is required for reporting with MS Office on the Information Server?,MS Office 32 bit (2013 SP1, 2016), VSTO 4.0, .NET framework V4.5.1, and IS Office PlugIn.","For MS Office reporting, you need Office 32 bit, VSTO 4.0, .NET 4.5.1, and the IS Office PlugIn.","Requirements include specific versions of MS Office, Visual Studio Tools, .NET framework, and an Office PlugIn.","MS Office, VSTO, .NET framework, and the IS Office PlugIn are essential for reporting.","Reporting capabilities require MS Office, development tools, and a plugin for integration."

,What are the requirements for implementing the PCS 7 Web option?,It can be used in server/client structures or single stations, with version compatibility and hierarchy matching.",Requirements include compatibility with previous PCS 7 versions and matching OS and AS area names.,The Web option needs a compatible plant hierarchy and supports cross-version connectivity.,Implementation requires hierarchy derivation from SIMATIC Manager or matching area names in OS and AS.,Key requirements involve plant structure flexibility and hierarchy or naming conventions alignment.

,How is the load on OS servers calculated when using both OS and Web clients?,The formula is: Number of OS clients * 2 + number of Web clients * 1 <= 60.,Calculate server load by doubling OS clients and adding Web clients, keeping the total under 60.","For mixed clients, use OS clients times two plus Web clients, not exceeding 60.","The load formula accounts for OS clients as double and Web clients as single, capped at 60.","Server capacity is determined by a weighted sum of OS and Web clients, with a maximum of 60."

,What configuration notes are important for the PCS 7 Web option?,Consider publishing operations based on server packages and enable 'WebNavigator' in User Administrator.,Publishing needs depend on server packages, and 'WebNavigator' must be selected for users.",Configuring involves calculating publishing operations and setting up 'WebNavigator' for access.,Key points include managing image publications and activating the WebNavigator option for users.,Essential configuration steps involve publication counts and user access settings for WebNavigator.
